title: Conquest of Kings
shortSummary: Joshua chapter 12 provides a detailed record of the kings and territories defeated by the Israelites under Moses and Joshua. It highlights God's faithfulness in granting victory over formidable enemies, marking the fulfillment of His promises to give the land to His people. This chapter serves as a historical summary of Israel's conquest on both sides of the Jordan River.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Israelite Conquest of Canaan under Moses and Joshua

keyCharacters.name: Joshua
keyCharacters.description: Successor of Moses who led Israel in the conquest of Canaan and distributed the land among the tribes.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: Servant of the LORD who led Israel out of Egypt and began the conquest east of the Jordan before Joshua.

keyCharacters.name: Sihon
keyCharacters.description: King of the Amorites defeated by Moses; ruled from Heshbon and territories east of the Jordan.

keyCharacters.name: Og
keyCharacters.description: King of Bashan, described as one of the last of the giants, defeated by Moses and Israel.

definitions.definition: A river east of the Jordan River marking part of the territorial boundary of Israel's conquest.
Flat, low-lying land; in this chapter, it refers to the fertile areas east of the Jordan.
Refers to the Anakim or Rephaim, a race of large people mentioned in the Old Testament.
The land given by God to Israel as an inheritance after conquest.

outline.heading: Kings defeated east of the Jordan
outline.description: This section lists the kings Sihon and Og defeated by Moses and Israel, describing the extent of their territories east of the Jordan. It emphasizes God's provision of land to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half of Manasseh.

outline.heading: Kings defeated west of the Jordan
outline.description: A comprehensive list of thirty-one kings defeated by Joshua and Israel on the west side of the Jordan. The passage underscores the complete conquest of Canaanite territories and the fulfillment of God's promise to Israel.

application: Trust in God's promises and His power to give victory over spiritual and physical challenges, just as He gave Israel victory over their enemies.
Remember and recount God's faithfulness in past victories to strengthen faith in present trials.
Obedience to God's commands leads to blessings and inheritance; like Israel, believers are called to possess what God has promised.
Recognize the importance of leadership under God's guidance, as exemplified by Moses and Joshua, in fulfilling God's purposes.

keyVerses.text: Them did Moses the servant of the LORD and the children of Israel smite: and Moses the servant of the LORD gave it for a possession unto the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights Moses' role in conquering and distributing the land east of the Jordan, showing God's faithfulness through His servant.

keyVerses.text: The king of Tirzah, one: all the kings thirty and one.
keyVerses.significance: Summarizes the complete conquest of thirty-one kings, demonstrating the thoroughness of Israel's victory under Joshua.
